page.title: 15FARMING (CONSERVATION)
page.content: Both of the farms visited had buildings or areas under conservation orders.On the first was a thatched, three sided ,open fronted barn dating from the middle of the 16 century ,it is at present used to store tractors and has to be maintained at the farmer's own expense.On the same farm is a chalk quarry of great geological interest in which some of the chalk deposits are eight million years old.Access has to be given to visitors now coming from as far a field as America.Helmets and tunic buttons dating from the civil war have been turned up during ploughing .On both farms there are the remains of Roman encampments and on the second the site of a villa where a Roman tile showing the paw marks of a dog was found. The farmer has planted areas of woodland which he regards as conservation.
